segment.source: Network access Allow anonymous SID/Name translation (Windows 10)
segment.target: Network access Allow anonymous SID/Name translation (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Network access Allow anonymous SID/Name translation security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Network access Allow anonymous SID/Name translation security policy setting.

segment.source: Network access: Allow anonymous SID/Name translation
segment.target: Network access: Allow anonymous SID/Name translation

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Network access: Allow anonymous SID/Name translation security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Network access: Allow anonymous SID/Name translation security policy setting.

segment.source: This policy setting enables or disables the ability of an anonymous user to request security identifier (SID) attributes for another user.
segment.target: This policy setting enables or disables the ability of an anonymous user to request security identifier (SID) attributes for another user.

segment.source: If this policy setting is enabled, a user might use the well-known Administrators SID to get the real name of the built-in Administrator account, even if the account has been renamed.
segment.target: If this policy setting is enabled, a user might use the well-known Administrators SID to get the real name of the built-in Administrator account, even if the account has been renamed.

segment.source: That person might then use the account name to initiate a brute-force password-guessing attack.
segment.target: That person might then use the account name to initiate a brute-force password-guessing attack.

segment.source: Misuse of this policy setting is a common error that can cause data loss or problems with data access or security.
segment.target: Misuse of this policy setting is a common error that can cause data loss or problems with data access or security.

segment.source: An anonymous user can request the SID attribute for another user.
segment.target: An anonymous user can request the SID attribute for another user.

segment.source: An anonymous user with knowledge of an administrator's SID could contact a computer that has this policy enabled and use the SID to get the administrator's name.
segment.target: An anonymous user with knowledge of an administrator's SID could contact a computer that has this policy enabled and use the SID to get the administrator's name.

segment.source: This setting affects the SID-to-name translation as well as the name-to-SID translation
segment.target: This setting affects the SID-to-name translation as well as the name-to-SID translation

segment.source: Prevents an anonymous user from requesting the SID attribute for another user.
segment.target: Prevents an anonymous user from requesting the SID attribute for another user.

segment.source: This is the default value on member computers; therefore, it will have no impact on them.
segment.target: This is the default value on member computers; therefore, it will have no impact on them.

segment.source: The default value for domain controllers is Enabled.
segment.target: The default value for domain controllers is Enabled.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: The default value of this setting has changed between operating systems as follows:
segment.target: The default value of this setting has changed between operating systems as follows:

segment.source: The default on domain controllers running Windows Server 2003 R2 or earlier was set to Enabled.
segment.target: The default on domain controllers running Windows Server 2003 R2 or earlier was set to Enabled.

segment.source: The default on domain controllers running Windows Server 2008 and later is set to Disabled.
segment.target: The default on domain controllers running Windows Server 2008 and later is set to Disabled.

segment.source: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.
segment.target: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.

segment.source: Modifying this setting may affect compatibility with client computers, services, and applications.
segment.target: Modifying this setting may affect compatibility with client computers, services, and applications.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: If this policy setting is enabled, a user with local access could use the well-known Administrator's SID to learn the real name of the built-in Administrator account, even if it has been renamed.
segment.target: If this policy setting is enabled, a user with local access could use the well-known Administrator's SID to learn the real name of the built-in Administrator account, even if it has been renamed.

segment.source: That person could then use the account name to initiate a password-guessing attack.
segment.target: That person could then use the account name to initiate a password-guessing attack.

segment.source: Disable the Network access: Allow anonymous SID/Name translation setting.
segment.target: Disable the Network access: Allow anonymous SID/Name translation setting.

segment.source: Disabled is the default configuration for this policy setting on member devices; therefore, it has no impact on them.
segment.target: Disabled is the default configuration for this policy setting on member devices; therefore, it has no impact on them.

segment.source: The default configuration for domain controllers is Enabled.
segment.target: The default configuration for domain controllers is Enabled.
